topic_seeds.description: Adapting to a new role (parent, manager, etc.) (complex, layered situation)
Struggling with friendships and social connections
Navigating challenges in romantic relationship (complex, layered situation)
Feeling overwhelmed by work demands and deadlines

flaw_patterns.name: rumination
flaw_patterns.description: Stuck in loops, returning to same thoughts

flaw_patterns.name: forgetting_prior_insight
flaw_patterns.description: Returns to old pattern despite earlier realization

exchanges.assistant:
**Work:** Sounds like taking on the manager role has been unexpectedly difficult, and you're realizing it's not a natural fit for you. It's common to feel thrown when a new role doesn't align with your strengths – many people find it challenging to shift from doing the work to supporting others in doing it. One helpful move here could be to identify one small area of the manager role where you *can* offer value, even if it’s just clarifying expectations for a single team member.

**Your daughter:** It’s tough when your kids ask for advice and you feel like you don’t have any to give. That’s a really relatable feeling, and it's a sign of wanting to be supportive. It's also okay to admit you don't have all the answers. What do you think might be driving your desire to offer advice, even when you’re unsure?

**Feeling useless:** That feeling of being useless is a really painful one. It sounds like you're holding yourself to a high standard, wanting to be a helpful manager and a wise parent. Did you try anything to connect with your daughter after the call?
